summary: We examined school shootings and found: Half were committed by current or former students Suburban and rural, wealthier, and low-minority schools had more school-targeted shootings; such shootings were the most fatal and most commonly committed by students Urban, poor, and high-minority schools had more shootings overall and more motivated by disputes; these shootings were often committed by non-students or unknown shooters More shootings happened outside...
title: K-12 Education: Characteristics of School Shootings
